Students interested in the Diploma in Innovation can apply here. a postgraduate coursework student transferring to any other postgraduate coursework course (excluding postgraduate online courses, C04372 Master of Data Science and Innovation and Graduate School of Health courses with exceptions);please note: if you have not commenced your postgraduate course, please submit an application via the UTS Student Portal (postgraduate applications tile)a C04525 Master of Pharmacy student transferring into C04395 Master of Pharmacy (International) or vice versa;a student in a Goods Manufacturing Course transferring to another Goods Manufacturing Course;transferring into one of the following Master of Philosophy courses:C04267 Master of Philosophy in Science;C04389 Master of Philosophy in Medical Biotechnology;C04393 Master of Philosophy in Forensic Science;If you don't meet any of the above criteria, you will need to apply for admissions in the standard application process. [HEADING] Will I still retain my CSP if I change my study load (from full-time to part-time or vice versa) after the commencement of the course?
[HEADING] I received a postgraduate domestic fee-paying offer but applied before the CSP closing date. Will I still be considered for CSP?
[HEADING] Can I still retain my CSP if I defer my offer?
[HEADING] I’ve already started my course. Can I still be considered for a CSP?
[HEADING] I submitted a course transfer (continuing) application. Will I be considered for CSP?
[HEADING] I received an offer by invitation from the faculty. Will I be considered for CSP?
[HEADING] What if I don’t want a CSP?
Ready to take the next step in your study journey but concerned about the cost?
Your postgraduate degree could be more affordable than you realise with a Commonwealth Supported Place (CSP).
CSPs (reduced fee subsidised by the government) are available in a wide range of UTS courses. No separate application is required.
Applications are currently open for 2025.
To be considered for a CSP to one of our available degrees you must either:
CSPs for postgraduate courses are competitive as there are limited places available. The number of places and applicable courses vary each year, based on government funding, and are allocated based on merit. Certain courses may also have minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) requirements. Please see the respective course pages for details.
Applications are assessed on an ongoing basis, and we recommend that you apply early to be considered. You must:
If you're eligible for a CSP offer, you’ll be notified of the outcome via email. As places are competitive, it’s important that you accept your offer by the lapse date indicated in your offer correspondence to retain your place.
You must submit your application by the following dates to be considered for each respective round.
Applications received after Round 1 will only be considered if CSPs are available.
*If you applied for the Master of Pharmacy or Master of Pharmacy (International), you may not receive your CSP outcome until commencement of Autumn B session.
Please refer to the website for the Graduate Diploma in Midwifery for information on application deadlines.
The following postgraduate programs have Commonwealth Supported Places available. Places are limited, so apply early to not miss out.

Yes. We understand that your circumstances may change throughout the year which may impact your study load. Your eligibility for a CSP will not be affected.
You’ll be considered for CSP for the respective round depending on when you submit your application. All applications are reviewed after the closing date with offers released in accordance with the release date for the respective round.
Please refer to your offer correspondence which will note whether you’re still being considered for CSP.
No, as places are competitive, you’ll need to reapply to be considered for a future intake once you’re ready.
You are only eligible for consideration for a CSP if you are commencing in the course.
Please submit a direct application via the UTS Student Portal (postgraduate applications tile) to be considered for a CSP.
If you don’t want to be considered for a CSP, simply indicate 'No' in your application form for the course you’re applying for.
• be an Australian or New Zealand citizen;
• hold an Australian permanent residency visa; or
• hold an Australian permanent humanitarian visa
• Apply for your desired course via the UTS Student Portal (postgraduate applications tile); and
• Complete the CSP question in the application form. No separate application is required.

Will I still retain my CSP if I change my study load (from full-time to part-time or vice versa) after the commencement of the course? Yes. We understand that your circumstances may change throughout the year which may impact your study load. Your eligibility for a CSP will not be affected.
Will I still retain my CSP if I change my study load (from full-time to part-time or vice versa) after the commencement of the course?
Yes. We understand that your circumstances may change throughout the year which may impact your study load. Your eligibility for a CSP will not be affected.
I received a postgraduate domestic fee-paying offer but applied before the CSP closing date. Will I still be considered for CSP? You’ll be considered for CSP for the respective round depending on when you submit your application. All applications are reviewed after the closing date with offers released in accordance with the release date for the respective round.  Please refer to your offer correspondence which will note whether you’re still being considered for CSP.
I received a postgraduate domestic fee-paying offer but applied before the CSP closing date. Will I still be considered for CSP?
You’ll be considered for CSP for the respective round depending on when you submit your application. All applications are reviewed after the closing date with offers released in accordance with the release date for the respective round.  Please refer to your offer correspondence which will note whether you’re still being considered for CSP.
Can I still retain my CSP if I defer my offer? No, as places are competitive, you’ll need to reapply to be considered for a future intake once you’re ready.

UTS strongly supports the right of all people who wish to undertake a course at our university to pursue their goals and achieve their personal potential. We welcome prospective students with disabilities, and students from diverse social, economic and cultural backgrounds.
An inherent requirement is an academic or non-academic requirement that is essential to the successful completion of a course.
Inherent requirements statements have been developed for UTS courses to support current and prospective students' decision making. These statements specify the inherent requirements of each course for student assessment and progression.
The framework for inherent requirements is based on six groups of tasks that will be required as part of a course:
Legal and Behavioural Requirements;
Communication Tasks – verbal; written; non-verbal;
Knowledge Tasks (Cognitive/Intellectual) – literacy; numeracy; knowledge and information;
Observation Tasks (Sensory) – visual; auditory; tactile;
Practical Tasks (Physical) – gross and fine motor requirements; and
Sustainable Performance.
UTS is committed to making reasonable adjustments to teaching and learning, assessment, practice experiences and other activities to ensure that all students, including those with disabilities or chronic health conditions, can fully participate in their course.
Read more about inherent requirements as they relate to inclusive learning environments.
While some UTS courses have specific inherent requirements, most courses are grouped by their course area or faculty and have shared inherent requirements.
Expand the sections below to find the inherent requirements statements of each UTS course.
All UTS Business School courses share the same inherent requirements.
